fields.summary: Initial plan setup causes FM exception

fields.description:
We have 200+ Maven plans configured on one Bamboo instance and some of them are nightly plans with a once-a-day trigger. 

On upgrading to 2.5 I set all plans to use the Maven2 dependency management. The problem is that I don't want regular CI plans to trigger nightly plans(as they are resource intensive). When I remove POM dependency management from the nightly builds, it doesn't stop them from being triggered by regular CI plans. I have no choice now but to take the Maven 2 dep management off all plans.

Oh well, it was nice while it lasted. 

So - any way to stop the Maven 2 dependencies from crossing from plans of one build strategy (polling) to plans of another (single daily build)?
fields.summary: Cannot undo Maven POM dependency management

Add CVS and P4 repo options.

fields.description:
If a bamboo box is behind a proxy server and specific proxy related host and port parameter need to be parsed to the jvm (java.net package?) ... They will not be recognised by bamboo.

The [ec2 api tools|http://developer.amazonwebservices.com/connect/entry.jspa?externalID=351&categoryID=88] however recognise the following parameters.
{panel}-DproxySet=true 
-DproxyHost=<host-ip> 
-DproxyPort=<port> 
-Dhttps.proxySet=true 
-Dhttps.proxyHost=<host-ip> 
-Dhttps.proxyPort=<port>
{panel} 
when declared as {{EC2_JVM_ARGS}}
fields.summary: Cannot connect to AWS/EC2 when bamboo app server is behind a proxy. EC2_JVM_ARGS have no effect

fields.description:
First: create a build plan using CVS as source repository and specify a module to be used.
Second: create another build plan and select "Clone an existing build plan?" then select the other plan. Click "Next >>" and change the CVS module to be used. Click "Next >>" until the new plan can be saved and tries to do it's initial build... you will notice that it uses the CVS module specified in the initial build plan instead of the new one specified.

Workaround: Abort the initial build and change the module again in the new plan's configuration... afterwards the module is set correctly.
fields.summary: CVS module field doesn't store changes when cloning an existing build plan

fields.description:
We run the same test suite on very many platforms to test that each platform works.  We do this by having a plan for each platform. When a test fails, I usually want to know whether it has failed in any of the other plans that run the same tests.

It would be really great if the "Test History" view could be expanded to include the history of a test across other plans.
fields.summary: Report to see failures of an individual test across multiple plans

fields.description: So plugin developers can write their own bulk action items.
fields.summary: Make Bulk Actions Plugable

fields.description:
When a user has to downsize bamboo instance the use is directed to a delete plans screen. 
The link points to the bamboo server the last export was made from.
Plans on the _previous_ server are deleted _not_ on the current. The previous server may still be active and eligible to run unlimited plans. 

On that screen a neon warning should be displayed and the base url should be questioned (if not the same as the current hostname/ip address)
fields.summary: When downsizing a license plans users are directed to delete on the _old_  server

fields.description:
Bamboo to prompt the user if the base url should be exported in case the instance is moved to a different server.

In case an instance is moved to a different server the user should be prompted about the current base url.
Base url should not be included in the export if the user chooses to move to a different server.

On the new server after the import the user should be directed to enter the new base url.

This new base url should also be used to configure the broker connections on the new server.
fields.summary: Configurable base url on export

fields.description: If sufficient agent capacity exists, then remote or local agents should be prefered over ec2 to allow ec2 agents to timeout and shutdown if not used.
fields.summary: Ability to specify preferred agents (local, remote or ec2) for builds

fields.description: It would be nice to have feature allowing the user to create a snapshot of the EBS volume attached to an Instance without logging into that instance via ssh before shutting in down. At the configuration step of an Image, when setting the snapshot id of the volume to attach, an option for auto generate snapshot on shutdown will save a lot of time, instead of logging in to perform that script call manually each time.
fields.summary: create EBS volume from Bamboo

fields.description:
It'd be great if when triggering a manual build through the build API, if custom parameters could be passed in.  These parameters could then be used to substitute values in the builder configuration for example.  For example, if I have a build that releases some software, I might have my maven 2 builder configured to say mvn release:prepare release:perform -Drelease.version=${bamboo.release.version}, and then when triggering the build via the remote API, I might say bamboo.release.version=1.1.  Any parameters that start with "bamboo." would be passed into the parameters of the build.  Then my external release management tool (JIRA) could tell Bamboo to perform the release.

Note, I've checked out the implementation for this already, it's an incredibly simple thing to implement passing in custom parameters to the build execution manager.
fields.summary: Allow Build REST API to receive custom parameters

fields.description:
I started a brand new Bamboo Home (2.5).  After running the setup wizard in Bamboo and running a few builds, I added a new plan status gadget to jira (4.0) and got the error below (see screen shot also).  The error could also be seen when hitting the straight rest urls: 

http://localhost:8085/bamboo/rest/api/latest/build/SVN/DEF?expand=builds[0%3A9].build&max-results=10

Notifications are not affected (runs through similar code) just the REST calls.

fields.description:
we are currently running multiple projects on our bamboo server. Each project using Maven 2 has the ability to enable plugins at the application level in the POM. If we do not have a license for the particular plugin, or a license for the most recent plugin (such as with a clover update), then the build will fail.

We would like a way to easily control what version of a plugin a project is allowed to use - Perhaps as an option in the bulk edit section of the admin console.
fields.summary: request ability to  control versions of plugins projects can use - for licensing reasons.

fields.description: In Administration -> Security -> Security Settings -> Enable Restricted Administrator Mode, the description of the filed has a typo (Restrcited).
fields.summary: Typo in description of field in Administration section

fields.description:
Add a checkbox to delete the builds working directory after the build to control the amount of disk space in use

It would be excellent if this https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/IT/2010/01/11/Pre+and+Post+scripts+on+BEAC+agents+to+clean+up+builds was incorporated into the product at a per plan level
fields.summary: Ability to delete build working directory after a suceessful build

fields.description: ${system.bamboo.agent.home} needs to be defined for all agents, otherwise it makes running pre and post build scripts break.
fields.summary: ${system.bamboo.agent.home} should be defined for all agents, not just remote ones

fields.description:

We are trying to condense this information.

There is a bug on this page which also needs to be fixed, see screenshot: http://skitch.com/brydiemccoy/n8fbq/jdks-atlassian-bamboo

Investigate surrounding/similar pages and identify if any other work needs doing.

fields.description:
Bamboo Agent upload of artifacts fails to set Content-Length:, causes problems when using a proxy that implements strict HTTP/1.1

Our preferred reverse proxy solution is Lighttpd. However, use of Lighttpd resulted in failure of Bamboo Agents to upload artifacts to the Bamboo Server.

Upon investigation, we discovered the following error in the Lighttpd error logs:

2010-01-08 13:50:26: (request.c.1115) POST-request, but content-length missing -> 411 

HTTP/1.1 - http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt - Section 4.4:

    ...
    For compatibility with HTTP/1.0 applications, HTTP/1.1 requests
    containing a message-body MUST include a valid Content-Length header
    field unless the server is known to be HTTP/1.1 compliant. If a
    request contains a message-body and a Content-Length is not given,
    the server SHOULD respond with 400 (bad request) if it cannot
    determine the length of the message, or with 411 (length required) if
    it wishes to insist on receiving a valid Content-Length.

And below in section 10.4.12:

    10.4.12 411 Length Required

    The server refuses to accept the request without a defined Content-
    Length. The client MAY repeat the request if it adds a valid
    Content-Length header field containing the length of the message-body
    in the request message.

And further below in section :

    14.13 Content-Length

    The Content-Length entity-header field indicates the size of the
    entity-body, in decimal number of OCTETs, sent to the recipient or,
    in the case of the HEAD method, the size of the entity-body that
    would have been sent had the request been a GET.

    Content-Length = "Content-Length" ":" 1*DIGIT

    An example is

    Content-Length: 3495

    Applications SHOULD use this field to indicate the transfer-length of
    the message-body, unless this is prohibited by the rules in section
    4.4.

    Any Content-Length greater than or equal to zero is a valid value.
    Section 4.4 describes how to determine the length of a message-body
    if a Content-Length is not given.

    Note that the meaning of this field is significantly different from
    the corresponding definition in MIME, where it is an optional field
    used within the "message/external-body" content-type. In HTTP, it
    SHOULD be sent whenever the message's length can be determined prior
    to being transferred, unless this is prohibited by the rules in
    section 4.4.

According to my research, both Microsoft IIS and Lighttpd are strict on this. I have confirmed that Lighttpd does not have a configuration option to disable this level of strictness. Apache, however, is lax about enforcing this rule. As a result, Apache works and Lighttpd fails.

Please correct the Bamboo Agent upload of artifacts to specify a Content-Length according to the specification defined above so we can switch back to Lighttpd.

fields.description:
When using cvs ampersand modules on a tag/branch bamboo checks out the _initial_ working copy just fine.

For subsequent builds bamboo *deletes* all files in the working copy when updating.

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-2452
fields.summary: CVS deletes working copy when using tag/branch and ampersand modules after initial build

fields.description: BEAC at the moment assumes that all Jira Issue ids are mean to go to JAC.  I'd really like to be able to log commit messages such as "PFE-130@studio.atlassian.com" and have Bamboo fetch the details from the server I've labbeled (with a default going to say JAC)
fields.summary: Issue ID's in commits should be able to point at multiple JIRA hosts

fields.description:
I have a maven installation setup just for Bamboo's usage, and didn't have any need for $HOME/.m2/settings.xml, so I just configured $M2_HOME/conf/settings.xml instead. After enabling maven2 dependency support in 2.5, I was getting the error message:

Failed to execute plugin 'Maven2 Build Processor' with error: When not aligning with a user install you must specify a local repository location using the setLocalRepositoryDirectory( File ) method

I then copied to the settings.xml file to the .m2 directory of the bamboo server's user's home directory, and everything worked fine.
fields.summary: bamboo-plugin-maven2 doesn't seem to recognize $M2_HOME/conf/settings.xml

fields.description:
Currently build result is created before build is run.
If build was not executed properly, result page for such build is broken (buildResultSumary.getDeltaState() for example).
fields.summary: Build result view for non executed build shows ftl errors
BuildState not set properly when build is not run, UI also dies

fields.description:
Currently when bamboo starts there are no EC2 agents configured to start on boot. Agents can be manually (or automatically) shutdown, however once this has occured a new agent will not be spawned in its place.

I would like to propose 3 new options for configuring ec2 agents

# Min number
# Max number
# Max spare

Using these three variables on boot bamboo would automatically start the min number of agents, as builds are triggered, if no agents were available, an additional ec2 agent would be started, up to the max number of configured agents.

Additionally, as build plans are serviced, if there were more than the max spare agents available, agents should by configured to shutdown to reduce the number of compute hours going to waste
fields.summary: Allow bamboo to start EC2 agents on boot

fields.description:
-tab for permissions to be configured
-tab for permissions to be viewed
-hide links/block actions if not permitted
-check different types of permissions, as well as different users, logged in / anonymous
-check non-chains permissions still work
fields.summary: Security for Chains

fields.description:
We have a number of build plans in our environment, which will eventually grow to a couple hundred or more.  With this many jobs, the All Plans tab becomes unmanageable.  The My Bamboo tab works well, but it'd be nice to allow someone to browse a group of build plans without having to select as favorite everytime.  It would be great if we could define new custom tabs to represent a group of builds, with a method to select which Projects should be visible under each tab.

There is currently a plugin that somewhat does this, but it doesn't work so well and is hard to maintain since it has to be done by the admin in a config file.
fields.summary: Allow for Custom Tabs to be Created to Better Organize Build Plans

These DB changes has to be considered:

create table CHAIN_RESULT (CHAINRESULT_ID bigint not null, CREATED_DATE timestamp, UPDATED_DATE timestamp, CHAIN_NO integer, BUILD_STATE varchar(255), CHAIN_ID bigint not null, primary key (CHAINRESULT_ID))
create table CHAIN_STAGE (STAGE_ID bigint not null, CREATED_DATE timestamp, UPDATED_DATE timestamp, NAME varchar(255) not null, DESCRIPTION varchar(255), BUILD_ID bigint not null, LIST_POSITION integer, primary key (STAGE_ID))
alter table BUILD add column BUILD_TYPE varchar(255)
create table STAGE_BUILD_ASSOCIATION (STAGE_ID bigint not null, BUILD_ID bigint not null, primary key (STAGE_ID, BUILD_ID))
alter table BUILDRESULTSUMMARY add column STAGERESULT_ID bigint
create table CHAIN_STAGE_RESULT (STAGERESULT_ID bigint not null, CREATED_DATE timestamp, UPDATED_DATE timestamp, NAME varchar(255) not null, DESCRIPTION varchar(255) not null, CHAINRESULT_ID bigint not null, LIST_POSITION integer, primary key (STAGERESULT_ID))
alter table CHAIN_RESULT add constraint FK9E6537B83C3FF79 foreign key (CHAIN_ID) references BUILD
alter table CHAIN_STAGE add constraint FKB613CFC0D96054AC foreign key (BUILD_ID) references BUILD

alter table CHAIN_STAGE_RESULT add constraint FKC07B17C433C66FC foreign key (CHAINRESULT_ID) references CHAIN_RESULT

BAM-5159

fields.summary: Upgrade Plugins to 2.4.2

fields.description:
* All upgrades are run rather than just the ones that are needed.
* This is only a problem if run after the initial install (where the upgrade task collections in UpgradeManagerImpl are already prepopulated with all upgrade tasks.)

This is fixed/avoided by:
* Do not do the import without restart.
* Stop and start Bamboo before the import.
* If it gets into a screwed state, delete your bamboo home and start again (don't accidentally delete the import!).
fields.summary: Importing without restart runs all upgrade tasks, if run after initial install.

fields.description: If attempting to import when you don't have enough disk space, bamboo will fail to unzip the directories correctly, but will not error, instead it continues to "import" your data.  The only problems/errors you see is when trying to access the UI after the import is finished and it can't do anything because your home is in a completely screwed up state.
fields.summary: Bamboo should gracefully handle import when run out of disk space.

fields.description:
The jar is then excluded, however, this can lead to confusion when startup fails further down the track.

We should try to remove the need for sevlet API, but this is required for atlassian-config to be loaded from the remote agent side.
fields.summary: Tomcat warns that servlet API exist in classpath

fields.description:
hitting the url e.g.

http://localhost:8085/bamboo/browse/MYNONEXISTING-PLAN/config

Results in the following stack trace in the logs:

http://localhost:8085/bamboo/browse/DES-YAYAA/config

And horrible exceptions all over the UI.
fields.summary: Exception when hitting config page for build that does not exist

fields.description:
The version of svnkit we bundle with bamboo doesn't have SASL support:

{noformat}[amyers@erdinger:svnkit]$ jar tf svnkit-1.3.0.5847.jar | grep Sasl
[amyers@erdinger:svnkit]$ 
{noformat}

If I download it from the website it does (this is a newer version, but apparently older ones have it too):

{noformat}
[amyers@erdinger:svnkit-1.3.2.6267]$ jar tf svnkit.jar | grep Sasl
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SVNSaslAuthenticator$SVNCallbackHandler.class
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SVNSaslAuthenticator.class
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SaslInputStream.class
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SaslOutputStream.class
[amyers@erdinger:svnkit-1.3.2.6267]$ 
{noformat}

Is there any technical reason we don't bundle the support for SASL authentication?
fields.summary: SASL support with bundled svnkit

fields.description: Bamboo does not shutdown and startup cleanly when stopped and started via the tomcat application manager. This is due to background services and frameworks not honoring the webapp shutdown request.
fields.summary: Bamboo does not shutdown and startup cleanly when stopped and started via the tomcat application manager

fields.summary: JIRA integration with https:/studio.atlassian.com may block whole Bamboo

fields.description:
steps to reproduce:
1) disable Remote Agents (they are disabled by default after clean instalation), stop Bamboo server ( ./bamboo.sh stop )
2) in bamboo-home/bamboo.cfg.xml edit:
(...)
"<property name="bamboo.jms.broker.uri">tcp://very.invalid.ip:54663?wireFormat.maxInactivityDuration=300000</property>"
(...)
(instead of more valid: "...tcp://127.0.0.1:54663....")

3) start Bamboo server ( ./bamboo.sh start ), 
4) log as administrator, go to Agents, click on "Enable Remote Agent Support"
5a) i expected message like "unable to bind tcp socket at very.invalid.ip:54663 - please fix bamboo.jms.broker.uri in bamboo.cfg.xml" or similar
5b) instead i've got:

fields.summary: Internal server error while trying to enable remote agents on bad socket

fields.description:
We let users enter a custom port number in Admin -> Mail Server page.

But if Bamboo is restarted the custom port number is lost
fields.summary: Bamboo mail port number is not persisted across restarts

fields.description:
Hi,

We'd like our ANT scripts to be do different things dependent on whether the current build is due to a code change or if it's a dependent build.  For example, if the build is a dependent build, then there is no need to publish a new JAR, as the source code won't have changed.

Would it be possible to have a bamboo variable with this information in it?

Many thanks,
Pete
fields.summary: Bamboo variable indicating whether a build is a dependent build or not

fields.description:
There are several things wrong with the bamboo.sh startup script:

1) an option to specify which user to run Bamboo under
2) The startup script takes no care of CWD. Depending on which directory you're in the startup behaves differently.
3) if Bamboo stops abruptly or startup fails, it leaves a bamboo.pid file and this file causes future startup attempts to fail.
4) make use of the JAVA_HOME in bamboo.sh script, Bamboo defaults to the java executable in the System Path - we ask users to set JAVA_HOME, but we never use it in the script
5) Parameterize each of the startup option in RUN_CMD variable or read the options from wrapper.conf file.
fields.summary: Improve the Bamboo startup script

fields.description: As Belinda suggested in https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-BAM-872#c15992

fields.description:
WMC 2010-02-05 - Description changed from (Allow users to re-order build queue)

In Bamboo 2.4.2, re-ordering the build queue is an action that is limited to administrators. If someone is watching a build, or is interested in the seeing the results of a build, and if they take the effort to visit the Bamboo site, then they should be able to bump their build to the top of the queue ahead of the multitude of other builds that happen to get triggered by the same change.
fields.summary: Add a "build reorder" permission
Add docs on how to upgrade an existing custom EC2 image
